title: Riot Engineering: LoL vs. the Real-time Internet PT. II

replies.body: Can you imagine that eventually there could be a generation of people who can't fathom the concept of lag?
you mean my children can have no lag but {{champion:104}} can't have a cigar?
some people cant fathom that right now
its called living in South Korea
Are the server for S. Korea in Seoul?
North Korea dont allow their people to play video games. so yes
^ common core at work
Whats lag?{{champion:223}}
Latency is the real term and not lag lol.
not really... latency is more what creates lag, lag is when it becomes noticeable and, in the case of us in internet games, causes impaired gameplay

In technical terms latency is an inherent problem in the way we transmit data. The data is sent via EM waves, basically light, and that light has to physically travel to a point, be read, and travel back, with the travel time being your ping, and latency being the time difference between when the information is sent and when the bounce back is recieved. Lag results from high latency, usually a result of poorly optimized routing such that instead of going from point A to point B, it travels to points C, D, E, and F first, in either direction or in some cases both. This poor optimization is what Riot is currently fixing by structuring a dedicated, customizable network.
Why did people down vote this? Lmao. Are you people offended that he was wrong? He had a good question. People don't even have a flexible enough brain to LEARN HOW TO LEARN.
networking is complicated work and so people down voted it because of the fact that it wasn't dumbed down to simpler terms.
Exactly what was going through my mind. Of course now my comment is down voted. :D
Logged in to upvote, although I believe we are the beginning of that generation :/

I did the same. Next Star Wars should start with.... 
In a world with no lag...
Well, before texting you had to mail a letter.
Rip Hide and Seek Players 2016
your name dude xD

If they take away Dominion (In this case they are) Shouldnt they at least give us some other Game Mode permanently ? That does not involve the classic 5v5 map and can be used to have fun as Dom was supposed to do. Who else agrees ? Like this friends! {{summoner:4}} Time is of the essence
The entire reason they took Dominion away is because they wanted to shift their employee resources away from that and focus it on Rift... adding another game mode would run entirely counter to that.
Not if the replacement permanent game mode is URF.

URF, too. Permanent game modes are expected to have perfect balance so that they can be continually sustained, whereas temporary modes are just fine skating by with extreme OP champs because half the fun is in identifying the OP picks. Balancing URF would be hell and extremely time-consuming.
Actually it would be impossible.

But that's the point.  When you play urf, you don't want to be balanced, you want to FEEL op.  You want to run around and murder things.  You're not looking for balance, you're looking to break the system.
To quote directly from the post, "alternative game modes work **better in short cycles** rather than as standalone queues."

>The entire reason they took Dominion away is because they wanted to shift their employee resources away from that

Implying they even had any employees working on dominion. They admitted it themselves, they weren't working on it, they legitimately neglected it. They really just didn't know what to do with it to fix it, so they just shut it down.

Riot is literally changing the way the internet works and all you guys can talk about is your godforsaken Dominion mode?

Give me a break. {{item:3070}} {{item:3073}}

Ummmm, no they aren't but nice try. They are utilizing existing architectures to allow for better game play. Backbones have been around for sometime now. You should also be pleased, I didn't talk about Dominion mode.
all other comments on here are killjoys. Go piss on someone else's rainbows and let the fellow love his Rito. {{summoner:30}}
I understand almost no one plays Dominion. But it should still be allowed on custom games. Some of us still like to play hide and seek.
Nobody plays dominion, and hide n seek is a huge waste of time. Play Hide n Seek on summoners rift if you really like it so much.

one problem with summoners rift is that the minions automatically spawn. on dominion, the minions don't spawn. another problem is that in rift, the turrets are also automatically on, so players can't move past half of them without dying. dominion has all turrets off so the whole map is playable (minus the fountains).

Holy crap! Turrets are taking over the US! Call the f*cking army!
"How does my internet not work. My location is great" {{champion:267}}

how bout y'all just add another server for NA? China has 7 or so alone, EU has 6-7, South Korea has like 3, but NA only has the one, and they moved it from Seattle to the middle of the continent. if there was a second server in Seattle to go with the one in the middle then there could be more people playing and having fun.
To be fair the US is quite big, three servers would be ideal, one on the west coast, one in the midwest, and one on the east coast.

Actually you are wrong, but it's not your fault because you were probably taught that like we all were and never corrected. America is in fact quite small.

http://www.businessinsider.com/mercator-projection-v-gall-peters-projection-2013-12

it takes up half a continent (well... canada has a lot of un-populated space, but you know what i mean). if that doesn't qualify as quite big (at least enough for more than one server), as well as the fact that (to my knowledge) Canada also uses the server in the US, along with the population density in some areas, i have no idea what you're getting at. NA really can utilise another server, especially seeing as a bloody large amount of foreigners ALSO play on the NA server.
@Wildgazer: it's not _that big_, but it's still big. that's what i'm getting at
